alert.note: Alert for Macon; Moultrie; Piatt (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 5:01PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Moultrie, southwestern Piatt and southeastern Macon Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 501 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mount Zion, or 7 miles southeast of Decatur, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cerro Gordo around 520 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hammond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for central Illinois.
